intro: Phippsia groenlandica, commonly known as the Greenland phippsia, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic regions of Greenland. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal environments, adapting to the harsh conditions of its polar habitat. It has a low-growing habit with slender stems and narrow leaves, and it blooms during the short summer season. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
